private_information: I can only manipulate vowel blocks: A E I
I can only move blocks that are currently at the top of a stack
I can move only one block at a time
vowel_agent.goal: Achieve the target block configuration where A is on top of B, B is on top of C, C is on top of D, D is on top of E, E is on top of F, F is on top of G, G is on top of H, H is on top of I, I is on top of J, J is on top of K, and K is on the table.

private_information: I can only manipulate consonant blocks: B C D F G H J K
I can only move blocks that are currently at the top of a stack
I can move only one block at a time
consonant_agent.goal: Achieve the target block configuration where A is on top of B, B is on top of C, C is on top of D, D is on top of E, E is on top of F, F is on top of G, G is on top of H, H is on top of I, I is on top of J, J is on top of K, and K is on the table.

orchestrator.goal: Coordinate the two agents so they jointly achieve the target block configuration where A is on top of B, B is on top of C, C is on top of D, D is on top of E, E is on top of F, F is on top of G, G is on top of H, H is on top of I, I is on top of J, J is on top of K, and K is on the table.

public_information: There are blocks labeled B G J A C I F K D H E

Initial stack configuration is: B is on the table, G is on the table, J is on top of G, A is on top of J, C is on top of A, I is on top of C, F is on top of I, K is on top of B, D is on top of F, H is on top of K, E is on the table
Both agents can only interact with blocks that are on the top of a stack
Both agents can move only one block at a time
One agent can only manipulate vowel-labeled blocks and the other can only manipulate consonant-labeled blocks

The goal is to rearrange the stacks to the target configuration where A is on top of B, B is on top of C, C is on top of D, D is on top of E, E is on top of F, F is on top of G, G is on top of H, H is on top of I, I is on top of J, J is on top of K, and K is on the table

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in writing PDDL domain and problem files targeting the FastDownward PDDL solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the given task. You must enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Use standard PDDL constructs compatible with FastDownward.
pddl.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following knowledge: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. This is the global goal to solve: {agents->vowel_agent->goal}. Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that represent only the information you have. Do not make assumptions beyond the information provided. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with FastDownward. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in writing PDDL domain and problem files targeting the FastDownward PDDL solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the given task. You must enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Use standard PDDL constructs compatible with FastDownward.
pddl.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following knowledge: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. This is the global goal to solve: {agents->consonant_agent->goal}. Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that represent only the information you have. Do not make assumptions beyond the information provided. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with FastDownward. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL planning and in composing PDDL domains and problems for the FastDownward solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. You must enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are multiple agents, keep their actions distinct and compatible with FastDownward.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. There are two agents that will provide PDDL domains and problems. You will receive their PDDL responses. You must integrate them to produce a combined PDDL domain and problem that allows the two agents to achieve the global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Keep in mind that the PDDL provided by agents may be partial or use different names for the same objects. Maintain distinct action names for each agent. Here is the PDDL from the first agent: {pddl_vowel_agent}. Here is the PDDL from the second agent: {pddl_consonant_agent}. Think step by step and provide a merged PDDL domain and a merged PDDL problem compatible with FastDownward. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.
